subject: Climate & Environment
title: Typhoons and Cyclones Around the World
description: One-minute skill: Typhoons and Cyclones Around the World.

hook.text: Hurricanes, typhoons, and cyclones are all the same storm. The name depends on where it forms.

buildup.text: Atlantic storms are hurricanes. Pacific storms are typhoons. Indian Ocean storms are cyclones.

discovery.text: The western Pacific produces the most and the strongest tropical storms on Earth each year.

twist.text: Typhoon Haiyan in 2013 hit the Philippines with 315 km/h winds â€” one of the strongest ever recorded.

climax.text: Bangladesh has lost over 500,000 people to cyclones since 1970. Geography makes it vulnerable.

punchline.text: Same storm, different name. The destruction doesn't change with the label.

quiz.question: What determines whether a storm is called a hurricane, typhoon, or cyclone?
options: The ocean basin where it forms
